parse.title: List of periods of regional peace

text.*:
The word "pax" together with the Latin name of an empire or nation is used to refer to a period of peace or at least stability, enforced by a hegemon.

  • Pax Americana
  • Pax Assyriaca
  • Pax Britannica
  • Pax Europaea
  • Pax Hispanica
  • Pax Hollandica
  • Pax Islamica
  • Pax Khazarica
  • Pax Mongolica
  • Pax Nicephori
  • Pax Nigeriana
  • Pax Ottomana
  • Pax Praetoriana
  • Pax Romana
  • Pax Sinica
  • Pax Sumerica
  • Pax Syriana
  • Pax Tokugawa[1]

See also[edit]

  • Peace § Long periods
  • Peace movements
  • Peace symbols

Notes[edit]

  1. ^ Akira Hayami, Osamu Saitō, Ronald P. Toby, The Economic History of Japan, 1600-1990: Emergence of economic society in Japan, 1600-1859, Oxford University Press, 2004, p. 87
